name: (2E)-2-hydrazono-1-naphthalen-1-yl-2-phenylethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1114

name: (2E)-2-hydrazono-1-naphthalen-1-yl-2-phenylethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1114
Reason: The compound (2E)-2-hydrazono-1-naphthalen-1-yl-2-phenylethanone is a complex molecule with multiple functional groups that influence its melting point. The base structure can be considered as naphthalene, which has a melting point of 80.2 degrees Celsius. The addition of a phenyl group would generally increase the melting point due to increased molecular weight and π-π interactions, potentially by around +20 degrees Celsius. The ketone functional group typically raises the melting point as well due to the possibility of hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions; we can estimate this increase to be around +20 degrees Celsius. The hydrazone group can form intramolecular hydrogen bonds, which would raise the melting point; we can estimate this as +30 degrees Celsius. Thus, considering the cumulative effects of naphthalene as the base unit (80.2) and the added functional groups, we add up the shifts: 80.2 (naphthalene base) + 20 (phenyl group) + 20 (ketone group) + 30 (hydrazone group).
